\def \articleTITLE{[Re] Periodic forcing of a limit-cycle oscillator: Fixed points, Arnold tongues, and the global organization of bifurcations}
\def \articleTYPE{Replication}
\def \articleDOMAIN{Non-linear dynamics}
\def \articleBIBLIOGRAPHY{bibliography.bib}
\def \articleYEAR{2022}
\def \reviewURL{}
\def \articleABSTRACT{The effects of periodic forcing on a nonlinear limit-cycle oscillator
          at varying relaxation rates may provide insight into the real behaviour of periodically-perturbed cardiac oscillators. Here we successfully replicate
          a mathematical model by Glass \& Sun (1994) analyzing the dynamics of a model system.
          We study the differing phase-locking regions given varying rates of return to the limit cycle,
          stimulus intensities, and time intervals between stimulations, as well as algebraically compute the instability boundary along the 1:0 and 1:1 (period \#: cycle \#) phase-locking regions.}
\def \replicationCITE{Glass, L., Sun, J. 1994. Periodic forcing of a limit-cycle oscillator:
         Fixed points, Arnold tongues, and the global organization of bifurcations.
         Physical Review E 50, 5077–5084. doi:10.1103/PhysRevE.50.5077}
